intro: Coccoloba fulgens, commonly known as the shining beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its striking red, fuzzy fruits that appear in clusters, often used as ornamental plants due to their visual appeal. Its leaves are typically lobed and can vary in shape depending on the environment. Coccoloba fulgens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
